concept.title: Keys in spatial view functions
concept.shortdesc: The key must be a multidimensional bounding box.

conbody.p: The keys in a spatial view function can defined in several ways:

section.title: Single values
section.p: When a single value is used in the key, it expands to a collapsed range.
For example, the [1, 2] value is stored as [[1, 1], [2, 2]].

section.title: Ranges
section.p: Use ranges for keys, for example, for shops with certain opening hours such as 10:00 to 20:00. This example uses timestamps and converts the values of 10:00 - 20:00 to 1000 and 2000.

section.title: GeoJSON geometry
section.p: You can use a GeoJSON geometry in a key. It must be the first element of the array. The bounding box is automatically calculated and used as the range.
